instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.12C_CAM_SCL: What is 12C_CAM_SCL? This is a typo of I2C_CAM_SCL When you see 12C_CAM_SCL, assume they meant to type I2C_CAM_SCL.
definitions.12C_CAM_SDA: What is 12C_CAM_SDA? This is a typo of I2C_CAM_SDA When you see 12C_CAM_SDA, assume they meant to type I2C_CAM_SDA.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no webcam
threads.message:
i tried different screen i tried new J8500 cable
 i get 5v on L4004
i get 5v on pin 46 on J8500
1.8v on pin 40 <SIGNAL>12C_CAM_SDA</SIGNAL>
1.8V ON PIN 38 <SIGNAL>12C_CAM_SCL</SIGNAL>
